Reviews.Title: “good value for such an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: 11trav11
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in Nov '11. Had to change rooms once due to heavy mold around door to patio and window. Changed to one at back of hotel that was a little tired but was more than sufficient for the number of hours we were there daily. Reasonably clean with a comfortable older bed and a well-stocked and operating washroom. Not a lot of continental breakfast choice but everything was very fresh and the coffee and juice top-notch. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Most importantly, you couldn't ask for a more practical location in Rome. In a long but leisurely day's walk we did the loop to Spanish Steps, St Peter's, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and back....and of course the metro less than a block away got us everywhere else. This may only be a 2-star hotel but my theory is that in Rome you could pay twice the price and not be any more satisfied, so we'd stay here again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 60MikeandLinda
Reviews.Content: Thank you Luca and team for a great stay. The hotel is very well situated, near the Metro station as well as via Veneto and the Hard Rock Cafe. Also close by the US Embassy. About a 10 to 15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountains and Spanish steps. The hotel is affordable for the area and well worth it. The included breakfast was good and the room was nice and clean. Elevetator was small, one person and 1 bag still great when you are in the 5th floor. We had room 502 with a small balcony, it was lovely. We will defenety stay here again. Grazie y arrivederci!!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ian C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an excellent location near the centre of historic Rome - the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Colloseum, to name but a few, are all within easy walking distance! We stayed for 5 nights, Thursday to Tuesday. Our only negative comment would be that not all the staff speak English, which was a nuisance at breakast-time on a couple of mornings over the weekend, but not a major problem by any means. The staff on reception all understood us very well and were very helpful, so our compliments must go to the owner and his staff. This hotel is an ideal place to stay for a short break in Rome, and we wouldn't hesitate to give it our recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kath91982
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights in April 2011. The location was great, we walked to all the big sights in about 20 min, and there was a train just down the street. It is an older hotel, but clean and a good amount of space for a European hotel. The staff was very friendly and the price was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItalyLove001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location! Just a few steps from Via Veneto and a short walk from Villa Borghese. It is in walking distance to most attractions. Rome hotels generally have a lower standard than a lot of the other cities in Italy, in which you don't get a lot for what you pay for. This room was a good size and had a nice bathroom. The breakfast was not really good. Only sweet breads and cereal were offered. I was disappointed that there was no fruit or yogurt. However we did get to start our day with a cappuccino. The people at the front were nice enough to allow us to use the computer downstairs. The only terrible part was that there were protests outside our window (near a government building) which was terribly annoying. For 10 hours we heard nothing but loud drums and yelling. It was terrible! However, it was not the hotel's fault. Overall, for Rome's standards, it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Toresansan
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Rome in the beginning of August 2011 with my girlfriend and both our parents. We all agreed that the staff was very friendly and aided us in any way they could. Some of our luggage was lost at the airport and they kept calling the airport for several days to try to find out where and when it could arrive at our hotel. The hotel in itself is located near a metro station so you'll be well connected to the city. In addition it's not far to walk (10-15min) to Pantheon and the surrounding sights. The rooms vary in size from rather small to more than large enough depending on how much you'd like to pay and how early you book. The beds are ok, not fantastic, but good enough for a week's stay. I've noticed that several people have complained about a bad smell in their room. We were spread out over several floors and we did not have any bad smells at the time we stayed so either this problem has been fixed or it is a passing problem. Hard to say. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will probably use the same hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “City Break in the summer!”
Reviews.Author: sandy24Ireland
Reviews.Content: we went to this hotel last july and it was cosy, Weather in rome was 40 degree, but rooms have a/con so its a major help! one life in hotel that you have to squash in if you want to get 2 people into it along with luggage but you have a great laugh over it! breakfast is basic, tea, coffee fruit cereal + scones etc. rooms are quite big considering the lift is tiny! we were at the bank of the hotel, near to where government buildings are, so the area is quite safe. lovely staff and very helpful, just remember NOT to eat the bread before you get dinner as irish and uk people think its complimentry when we get it at home! we were fooled on our first day when we were charged for it, other than over all lovely experience! metro is a 20 second walk away to rbing you all over rome!

Reviews.Title: “Better than average”
Reviews.Author: R E
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in October 2011 before we left for a cruise. I emailed the hotel a few times before we arrived and asked about leaving bags there before check-in since our flight arrived at 9am in Rome and the hotel replied back with no problem. We got to the hotel a little after 10am and they said that instead of leaving the bags, they would just let us check-in early because I notified them and they had a room which was perfect. Yes room is small if compared to American hotels, but if you have ever stayed in an Euorpean city, then it was average. Yes, small TV, but who cares because you are in Rome and there better things than TV. And no sewer smell that I read reviews about. Young man at front desk very helpful with map and walked us through so much and even gave many food options. Every staff memeber was helpful. This hotel is in a great location to walk to everything or jump on the Metro line for places like the Vatican. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not great..but location is good”
Reviews.Author: Jmonty26
Reviews.Content: This is more like a B&B than a hotel.. Rooms are extremely small, Wifi signal doesn't work in the room, shower barely worked, mold in the bathroom, hair dryer is more like a fan and the TV is so small you have to sit right in front of it. The ONLY good thing about this place is the location- easy to walk everywhere or jump on the Metro. If you don't plan on being in the room but to sleep than this place would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Madcow4985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cinquantatre this weekend past and were really disappointed with the experience. We payed much more than we usually do but got less service than anywhere else we have stayed. Firstly we arrived at 1.40pm unaware that checkin wasn't until 2 after checking our emails etc for 15 mins or so we asked how long until it would be ready and were told 30 mins. Not a problem we would go out for a walk and come back then. When we arrived back around 3pm the room still wasn't ready and we waited in a little room at the back of the hotel, with one sofa already occupied by another couple. When we finally got into our room I went to have a shower and their were pubic hairs all over the shower and sink. Why did they make us wait if they weren't cleaning it properly? The whole room was pretty tired and run down with mold in the shower, broken light switches and an ugly noisy aircon system. All of which would have been ok if we had been paying budget prices £50/night but at a £130 we felt ripped off. We had got a superior room expecting a treat! I dread to think what the standard rooms were like. Breakfast was upstairs on a terrace which was one of the features that sold me the hotel, unfortunatly there are only 3 tables on it and we struggled to get one. The breakfast was again disappointing, but the croissants were quite tasty. I know you don't get much with a european breakfast but the quality of what we had was low. Alright so there were some good points, mostly the location, right next to a metro station and 10 min walk to the Trevi fountain and the reception staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We would like to come again..”
Reviews.Author: Smetanka
Reviews.Content: In the centre of Rome, near Metro A Barberini station. 10 min walking distance to Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. Antique furniture, marble bathroom, wonderfull breakfast on the top of the hotel, helping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful and friendly staff, Good value for a charming budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddualba
Reviews.Content: Nima was working the front desk. He was very nice and knowledgeable. He spoke great english and also spanish . We were just looking for a hotel close to the US embassy because we had immigration problems returning to USA. We were able to stay there for a few nights without a reservation. The price was very reasonable. Great location, close to subway and some of the famous tourist areas like the Trevi fountains and spanish steps. The have a computer with internet you can use for free in the downstairs lounge. There is also wi-fi there. There is no internet in the rooms, but if you are going on a real vacation a free computer you can use for quickly checking email should be adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good for the price”
Reviews.Author: turtlers2
Reviews.Content: I can't understand the negative comments about this hotel. We were booked at the Hotel Modigliani and they were full so they put us in here for a night. The desk staff were all family and the owner was on the desk in the late afternoon. They all spoke excellent English and were helpful and attentive. The room was adequate in size and relatively clean. Remember this is Rome we are talking about, one of the world's most expensive places to stay. The elevator was extremely small, not room for a person and the suitcase. The view from the breakfast room on the roof was great and breakfast was fine. All in all we would stay here again. Our room was at the front on the second floor but we had no trouble with noise and the internal arangements kept the room quiet from neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Do not rely on your reservation'”
Reviews.Author: es_1903
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights in July 2010. However, when I and my wife arrived at the hotel, the man on the front desk told us he could not give our room since there was a problem related to a broken water pipe in the room. He had booked a room for us in a different hotel and he told that the room would be a superior one. Suprisingly, he did not even offer to call a taxi for us, he just said the hotel was 3 minutes walking distance from there. Actually, it turned to be an exhausting 15 minutes uphill walk with our luggages. When we got to that hotel, we realized that the room was superior to no room in any hotel in the world. Finally, we paid the same price for a poor farther hotel. I made a mistake booking this hotel. I had read a previous review telling the same story, I should have taken it into account.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: cc2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon. Location: right up the street from Barberini metro stop. The metro location is convenient but it is a tad far from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. Rooms: a little small (especially the bathroom) but adequate and clean. Several people have commented about a smell and it is a bit musty after showering. The little balcony is cute. Try to ask for a room not facing the street, if possible - there are buses and garbage trucks that start their days early! Service: the staff were all very nice and for the most part spoke excellent English. They made reservations for the Borghese Gallery and called to confirm our hotel reservation in Florence. Breakfast: upstairs in a cute breakfast terrace area. Nice spread of fruit salad, selection of croissants and pastries, rolls, cereals, and juices. Fresh coffees and teas. Internet: we didn't realize this, but there's a computer with free Internet on the first floor, where you would store luggage. Overall - great value for the money. Sure, it could be a little nicer, but for a equivalent price, you couldn't get anything close to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad smell”
Reviews.Author: twoweeksayear
Reviews.Content: Overall: Great location, good price, bad smell The best thing about this hotel was its location -- a 10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and not much farther to the Pantheon, Spanish Steps and some of the best squares. It was also a block from a subway stationm, making it very easy to get anywhere in Rome (we didn't have to take a cab once the entire trip). And the price -- about $120 a night when we stayed was excellent for such a great location. The room itself was fine, about what you'd expect for that price. But ultimately, I probably wouldn't stay here again. I had read some of the tripadvisor reviews before we left and saw that some complained about a sewage smell. I foolishly thought maybe that was just a problem during the summer or in certain rooms. I thought, "How bad could it be?" But it was a problem in March. When we asked if we could move to a different room, they said it would probably be the same in any room and gave us a can of air freshener. Luckily we didn't spend much time in our room, but it was a really unpleasant smell. Keeping the toilet lid shut and bathroom door closed seemed to help a bit, but sometimes we'd get back only to find one had been opened, probably as the room was cleaned -- and the smell was back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific budget hotel,fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: paulburrows
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a surprise birthday present, staying 3 nights. I hoped it would have Italian charm and character. I didn't expect Marriot or Raddison and the price I paid suggested that. I did get friendly service,lovely breakfast, clean room serviced daily, free internet, luggage holding service and an excellent location to visit all of Rome. The direct bus from the airport to Termini was 4 euros each and the metro from there to barberini ( 2 stops ) put me 100 yards from the hotel. For 1 euro each. From this metro station we went to Vatican and Collesseum. A 10 minute walk to the trevi fountain and the charm of the Roman streets. Full of restaurants and eateries for a variety of prices. From 10 euro set menu's to lavish a la carte. We had no need for a taxi all weekend. The room was more than adequate. With hair dryer, good bathroom facilities,plenty of space and a queen sized bed with clean sheets on every day. The shower was a bit low on pressure and we didn't have a balcony. we had free access to the ceiling balcony though and everything else was very good. We had a problem with our loo not flushing,this was fixed within the hour. Not bad for sunday night at 8pm??? My parents will be coming to Rome next spring and I will recommend this hotel - particularly as they don't walk too far and they can get about to everywhere from this hotel. I thank the staff and owners for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “not the best in town.......”
Reviews.Author: debsmillis
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome hot and tired and found that this hotel was not as expected. The entrance was very strange , small isnt the word ! The room was adaquate in size but the cleanliness was a lot to be desired. The bathroom in particular was very bad. The small juliet balcony overlooking the noisy road was full of cigarette ends and had not been cleaned for some time. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romat514
Reviews.Content: L'Hotel Cinquantatre was a beautiful hotel in the heart of Rome. Easily accessible to metro and cabs. The staff was friendly and spoke English nicely. The breakfast (excellent cappuccino) can either be eaten inside or outside on a veranda. My husband and I chose to eat in doors because our room had the most beautiful veranda on the top floor of the hotel. What a view, absolutely gorgeous. Free internet access in the hotel lobby, down the steps from the front desk. Will definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “charming friendly hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: AnnaER
Reviews.Content: This hotel very kindly gave us a last minute booking when i had completely stuffed up my apartment booking by outting the wrong date! I couldnt have booked a more charming hotel if I had tried, especially in may., they even gave us a very reasonable rate. We had a small double room on the first floor , looking over the street. Im not sure what other people expect but it was normal european hotel size with a great bed and a good size modern and clean bathroom. We loved it, we also liked watching the world go by from our window, waking up to the smell of fresh pastries baking in the morning. The rooftop breakfasterrace was a lovely place to eat those pastries with coffee made for you to your own liking before setting off to walk around Rome. The lift is small but they always are in small hotels. Stay here if you want a charming small hotel with friendly and very helpful staff that is close to all the sites, metro and good cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kste22
Reviews.Content: I have read the mixed reviews on the site about the hotel and am quite puzzled when people comment really negitively. On booking this hotel you need to have your eyes open to the fact, its not a Marriot, Sheraton, Le Meridien or even a Travelodge or Holiday Inn, what it is, is a old style small, comfortable and in its own way charming hotel. The room I we stayed in on the 5th floor was confortable quite spacious and did what we wanted, it that it was a base to go off and explore Rome. It is perfectly located 10 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps and a 25 min walk to the Coloseum. The breakfast in the morning is limited but enough and to sit out on the roof terrace to eat it is both relaxing and unique. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful to us and we never had any issues with cleanliness. The bed was made and sheets changed everyday and they had TV for when we fell in tired from walking all day. Next door is a nice Sandwich cafe called Ginos and we called in to buy or lunchtimes sandwiches everyday before heading off. I would recommend this hotel but only if you looking for a comfortable base to explore, if you want high quality modern rooms go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “53 pieces of ????”
Reviews.Author: Sf411
Reviews.Content: During our stay, we were much, much less than impressed. We had hoped to go to Rome to seek out some peace, and what we found was what would go into the toilet. This hotel sits on a very quiet street., the only plus of the whole place. Despite numerous stories of its great atmosphere and large rooms, we thought we had walked into the wrong hotel. Our room could only fit a small, double sized bed, all of our luggage (which was a lot because we intended to stay there many days) and a television on what now seems, in my memory, like a wooden crate. In addition, the bathrooms were a piece of work, with a gross, dirty sink and toilet, and a bathtub/shower that only earthworms would bathe in because of the amount of dirt. In addition, we couldn't get over the incredible smell of feces coming from the bathroom and filling the whole room. We had told them that we were going to have three people staying, but they only had that one small bed. The bed was way too small for me, my wife, and my child of ten years, so I had to sleep on the floor! To my knowledge, I think that they never would deliver an extra bed, but they wouldn't even be able to fit one into the room anyway. We were relieved to get out of there and on to Capri after our horrible nights there. But we still have a running joke about what the hotel name means: 53 pieces of poop.

Reviews.Title: “beware of changes”
Reviews.Author: OmaArkansas
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for two 'superior' rooms several months in advance only to be told when we arrived for a 3 night stay that no rooms were available...due to problems with leaks from rain. A couple who arrived just before us was told the same story. They did move us to a different hotel (they paid taxi fees) for 2 nights but insisted we return for the last night. If you are only in Rome for 3 nights, you do not want to spend your time changing hotels...unpacking, packing, unpacking. Miraculously our 'leak problem' was fixed for the last night although it rained for the 2 days/nights we were in the other hotel (Friday/Saturday). so you figure out how external leaks were repaired in the rain during the weekend. The owner came to transport us back to this hotel on Sunday morning but with an extremely small car. That meant he made 2 trips to transport 4 suitcases and we walked about 10 minutes to get there. The hotel has 'no lobby', just a desk at the entry. Rooms we finally got were adequate and were rated as 'deluxe' by the owner as a 'compensation' for our shuffling around. If this was 'deluxe, I'd hate to see what our 'superior ' rooms would have been like. They were on the 5th floor (up 6 flights of stairs since the elevator could not hold more than 2 people ..or 1 person and 1 suitcase. It is a small hotel and our floor had only 2 rooms, one with a terrace. It is a convenient location near bus and metro stops, cafes, walking distance to historical area of Rome. Would I stay there again? Probably, because of the convenient location, but I would check out other places first.

Reviews.Title: “we would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMonna
Reviews.Content: the hotel staff was great, all 24 hours. the room was big enough for both of us and a private bathroom and eleavater. close to a metro and buses. there were maney sites whithen walking distance. Also quiet at night. bravo

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: kait_b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cinquantatre in June. The staff were pleasant, and the hotel was very well situated. I could walk to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi fountain, and did walk back from the Vatican. It's also fairly close to central meeting places if you have booked one day tours through the city. I found the beds a bit hard - that's just taste - but the hotel was clean, and tidy for the days I stayed. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: faricas
Reviews.Content: Good location. Small and quite hotel. Simple but nice breakfast. You can walk to many historical sites. Nice price to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Zacky9011
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel knowing we were getting a great location. The room was clean and comfortable but small which was not a problem because we only needed it to sleep. We were so close to everything in downtown Rome and we were always out. The elevator is small but that is what makes up part of the charm. Staff were great. The continental breakfast was fine. If you need more then you will need to go to one of the many local cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well situated, friendly and clean.”
Reviews.Author: rovingross
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel on the recommendation of a travel agent and overall were very satisfied with it. It is very conveniently situated for sightseeing. The bedroom was comfortable and the bathroom well equipped and relatively spacious. Staff were very helpful and friendly and spoke reasonable English. We just found two down sides: firstly the breakfast was dull and limited - coffee and juice were fine, but the only cereal suppliled was corn flakes, and the bread and pastries were usually pre-packaged and bland. Secondly, there were no visible arrangements for what to do in the event of fire. Given that the hotel is a tall narrow building with only one staircase, a small lift, no fire escape, and we were on the 4th floor, we feared that if there had been a fire we would have fried.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit grungy inside”
Reviews.Author: LaChicaCanadiense
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights in this hotel in August 2009. It is in a fantastic location, just a 10 minute walk from the Spanish steps and 2 minutes to the nearest subway stop. The room was relatively small, but this wasn't a big deal considering most hotels in European cities are small by North American standards. The bathroom was equipped with modern fixtures and impeccably clean, so no complaints on that front. The bedsheets were also clean and crisp, but that's about where the cleanliness ended. The curtains were dirty and stained, the walls were dirty and stained, and the floors and room fixtures had seen better days. The blanket on the bed was thin and worn out (and with the air conditioning at sub zero temperatures, trust me, you need a decent blanket at night even though outside the hotel, it's infernally hot). I pretty much didn't want to touch anything else in the room besides the bathroom and the bedsheets UNDER the cover. There is a lovely little restaurant on the top floor of the hotel with a patio, which was great for having a cappuccino in the mornings. There wasn't really any food available, though, except rolls and croissants with butter. (Maybe you could ask for food, but we didn't bother since we wanted to get out and explore more of Rome). The staff were very friendly and helpful and most spoke at least a little bit of English so communication wasn't an issue. They offered maps and recommended places to visit and eat. We had a nice time at the hotel, but considering the slightly run down condition of the rooms, I don't think I would stay here again. Although I would definitely recommend this neighbourhood for anyone wanting to explore Rome-- everything is close at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Air Con broke down for 7 nights. Do not book”
Reviews.Author: Ross66Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 14 nights from 6-20 August 2009. The first 7 night experience was v positive. However during the last 7 nights (8 days) the Air Conditioning broke down for all the hotel rooms. This being at the hottest time in Rome average 36 -40C during the day and 32-34C at night. The Hotel does not have a service contract to fix the Air Con and failed to even provided fans until the 7th night of the AC failing. It was impossible to sleep and frankly v unpleasant to stay in the hotel. I personally had to buy a and assembly a fan. To make matters worse now on returning the hotel has only offered a 10% reduction as compensation they are not even paying for the fan I purchased and left with them (despite the fact they told me when I left they would reimburse me). I would strongly advise people not to stay in this hotel if you are staying in the hotter months in Rome (really April to October). I understand the agent I booked this hotel with has suspended the hote

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service and unbearable sewage smell in room”
Reviews.Author: Markedtraveler10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Cinquantatre for 5 nights in June 2009. It started off being a good experience - the room appeared clean, was a decent size for Rome hotels and the location was perfect (right outside the Metro stop Barberini) and close to the Spanish steps (10-15 minutes walk). The staff at the front desk (Nima and Hugo) were pleasant initially, until a problem with my room arose. The second night there was a strong smell of sewage in my Room 203 which lingered through my stay there. It was totally unbearable. I raised this to the attention of the front desk staff and they dismissed it, saying there has never been a sewage problem with the room before and they cannot do anything because it is a problem with Rome's sewage system. This is a load of crap (no pun intended) because it is obvious from the reviews I have read that countless people had the same problem with Room 203 - it reeks of sewage! I requested to be moved to another room, but the hotel staff could not offer me another one because the hotel was fully booked. Front desk staff Nima (speaks English well) and Hugo (cannot speak English) have zero problem solving skills. They did not know how to handle the situation and there was no Manager on duty. They spoke in Italian to themselves, smirking and joking which was incredibly rude. When I pointed this out, they said they were trying to lighten the stress - What a lie! When the Manager Mr. Bottari finally contacted me in the late evening via telephone, he was rude and started yelling at me trying to blame me for making a complaint!! I was so shocked at his lack of decency and lack of customer service skills. This man is crazy and should not be managing any hotel. This sewage smell problem sums up this small family-run hotel Cinquantatre -everything is fine and dandy until a problem arises. There is zero accountability and the staff do not care about making your stay comfortable and enjoyable! My advice is to avoid this hotel. There are so many other nice and reasonably priced hotels in central Rome!

Reviews.Title: “a very average hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrstug
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in April 2009. Easy to find just 5 min walk from nearest metro station. within waling distance to all major sights. we booked a superior room thinking it would be slightly better than the usual standard rooms.it was an ok size but smaller than i would have expected for paying more money, we ended up changing rooms as the bathroom had a horrible smell of drains coming from it. this wasn't a probem for the recption staff who were helpful. we ended up with a room on the front of the hotel which was noisy because of the road. the room again was small and so was the bathroom. after a day the shower stopped working so needed a replacement! again not what i would have expected from paying extra for a better room! breakfast was VERY minimal.. a coissant and a bread roll each! you had a choice of tea or coffee and orange juice. could have done with a little more to start the day on! i think rome has better hotels on offer than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Love Rome and hotel Cinquantatre”
Reviews.Author: Finn100Raisio
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome for the 5th time. The hotel was great, perfect location, 1 min to Metro, 2 min to fountain Trevi, and the centre of the city. Very clean, small, the rooms are comfortable, not too small and with a clean nice modern bathroom.The street is not too noisy during the night or in the morning.The hotel staff was extremely helpful with maps, reservations and internet connections to airlines etc. Good breakfast, with polite staff. We had a beautiful stay and we will again stay at hotel Cinquantatre during our next visit in Rome, which will be soon! love Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms - big odour”
Reviews.Author: Smoothie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights at the end of February. This is a small hotel which is in a great location - approx 10 mins walk to Trevi fountain /Spanish steps and 150m from metro. Plenty of restaurants in the general area. The hotel has a single door frontage and a small lobby area. The room (303) was small but clean with comfortable bed and good modern bathroom. Breakfast served on top floor and is simple but good with a selection of coffees. Having paid about 70 euro per night per room it is very good value for money. All great so far - so whats the catch? Our room and our friends room (103) both had a bad smell coming from the bathroom drains. This disappeared overnight but returned by next evening although had almost disappeared by the end of our stay on the Monday. However we didnt come to such a fantastic city such Rome to spend too much time in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: spookyeee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our honeymoon. We stayed on the fifth floor in their largest room. We did not pay for the expensive room, but upon check in where upgraded since their other rooms where full. It was fairly large for European standards. With a hard mattress, two night stands, a desk and a chest. The bath room was clean and had a hair dryer that resembled an old fashion American vacuum. It was a short walk to the metro which was very nice. There are many upscale establishments close, and Hard Rock was around the corner. Their breakfast consisted of cereal and pastries. You must try the crescent rolls, with their version of orange juice. You may enjoy breakfast on the roof top or they will give you a silver tray to take it back to your room. They pick up the tray when they do your daily maid service, which included fresh towels, new sheets, and taking out the trash. You do not need to keep up with your room key, you hand it to the person working the desk before you leave, and pick it up on the way out. It is not an inconvenience, they are quick with your key, and you have to walk by them anyways. They work the front desk 24 hours and most are very friendly and speak English well. On the day before we left I developed a kidney stone and the concierge desk phoned an ambulance and even drove my husband to the hospital behind the ambulance which was more than could have been asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, great location, reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: MikeG32768
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at L'Hotel Cinquantatre for a week in early November 2008. The location is great, less than a block from the Barberini metro station and a taxi stand, and walking distance to central Rome. We got a good package rate with airfare. Our room was a superior double on the back side of the hotel on the 5th floor. The hotel was fairly quiet, except for some early morning noise from the breakfast room one floor above. The bed was comfortable, and the room was fairly up to date (including lots of electrical outlets for recharging gadgets). The room was a bit larger than we expected, a pleasant surprise. The breakfast is fairly basic: one kind of cereal, yogurt, some rolls, croissants, and cheese, coffee and tea. No fruit. Overall we thought the hotel was a good value, and we had a pleasant stay. One important caveat: the hotel web site (lhotel53.com) claims that internet access is available. This is incorrect, there is no internet access provided by the hotel (although they claimed that they would provide internet access in the near future). Check before you book if you need internet access, or check for access points near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Matkalija_
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a central location near Barberini metro station (good connections to Termini etc.). The area (financial district) where the hotel is situated is perhaps not the most exciting in Rome but it's quiet (relatively speaking) and safe. The room was basic but clean and the staff helpful and friendly. The breakfast was served on a roof terrace which had a nice view over the neighbouring rooftops. The breakfast in itself was ok, typically Italian, so don't expect a huge buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BiniTravels
Reviews.Content: Small hotel on quiet side street near busier Piazza Barberini and 15 min walk to Fontana di Trevi. Restaurants and shops are nearby, but look for Internet in other neighorhoods.. Room was typical European size (small for american standards), but it was all we needed. Our room had a separate room for the toilet and bidet, instead of in the bathroom. A small tv was located in the closet. Breakfast was served on the top floor on their outside rooftop patio. There are only 3 tables outside so we ate inside once when it was at a busier time. The breakfast lady was very nice and helpful. Only a few slices of bread and cereal, no cheeses/meats or American breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: loopylou202
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect. It was within easy walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Spanish Steps and with the metro being at the bottom of the road it was a short underground ride to the Vatican and the Colloseum. The reception staff were very helpful and always pleasant. The rooms were clean and plenty big enough. We stayed in 102 which as mentioned by some others has an 'odour' coming from the bathroom. As the room was mainly a base this didn't bother us too much. Also a spray of deoderant cleared it quite quickly. The rest of our party stayed on upper floors and had no such problem. The breakfast was pleasant with options of croissants, rolls, cereal and yoghurt, with tea/coffee and juice. Breakfast can be eaten on the balcony or indoors, and the walk up to the top floor certainly wakes you up for the day ahead! We also made the most of the top floor balcony for illicit evening drinks! There is no serving bar, however the nearby supermarkets selling Peroni at ~£1 for a pint was much cheaper than the local bars! Would definitely stay there again, just avoiding room 102.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: pendlehill
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed at the hotel Cinquantatre for a five day holiday this last September. Having never been to the etenal city before we were pretty much novices about what location would be best to stay in, but we struck gold with the hotel Cinquantatre. It's location is perfect! It's iterally seconds away from the metro (at the end of the road), a sight seeing bus, lovely cafes and restaurants and the beautiful Piazza Barberini. The trevi fountain is only about a 5-10 minute walk down the main road. We invested in a metro 7 day ticket and it was worth the little we paid for it as it took us all around the main sites of Rome within minutes. The Hotel itself was really lovely. It was clean, comfortable, nicely furnished and basically just very pleasant to stay in. We were on the front face of the building and we had a mini balcony looking out onto the street. There was air conditioning in the room and it came with a television, a safe and a fridge with drinks and food inside. The bathroom was nice and the shower was good and strong! The staff were polite and helpful especially one of the ladies who served the breakfasts. Speaking of breakfasts they were tasty. We got a sugared croissant, a couple of bread rolls each, soft cheese, jams, honey, special k type cereal, and a choice of teas, cappacinos, cafe latte and orange juice. It was enough to keep us going all day. The breakfast terrace was gorgeous to sit out on in a morning and it really started your day off on a nice note to eat your breatfast 'al fresco' and take in the lovely view. My holiday to Rome was one of the best holidays I've ever had. The city itself is just breathtaking and it was only made more wonderful with having a nice place to stay in in a perfect location. I will definately use the Hotel Cinquantatre again next time I visit Rome...which please god will be soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eileen-Mark
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is small but clean. It is on a street off Piazza Barberini which is one of the main squares in Rome. Most things are within walking distance and if you do not want to walk, the Metro is 2 mintues from the Hotel on the Piazza. There is no Hotel lobby just a reception desk and the lift is very tiny but in a city like Rome where there is so much to see, all we did was showered and slept there so it was perfect. The room was small but as previously said both room and bathroom were clean. The shower door came off the hinges a couple of times so just bear this in mind if you get Room 203! Nice view of the street and our little balcony even had a small christmas tree on it. Very cute!! Breakfast was a continental - yogurt, one choice of cereal, croissants & cheese/jam. Basic but ok for the price. We got a great deal on this hotel through Alpharooms.com The only little gripe I would have with this hotel is the disinterested staff. Sometimes they did not even look at you as they handed you the key and I dont think that a simple hello greeting is too much to ask but it was not forthcoming unless we initiated it. Maybe they were just not happy to be working over the New Year so I will give them the benefit of the doubt!!! Next time in Rome we will probably stay at this Hotel again based on its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HolidayNutSi
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome in July and had stayed 4 nites at Cinquantatre. I had selected this over a couple of other hotels because of its proximity to the metro station. It is good value (EUR 100/nite incl.taxes) for breakfast and a good location. The Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps are a 10 minute stroll away, so you would not have problems with restaurants. The breakfast is served on the balcony of the top floor which is very nice to start the day off. They serve a basket of bread (crossiants, soft rolls) with preserves and nutella *yummy*, juice and coffee/tea. Upon check in we were served by Nemo (I think that was his name!) which was very friendly and helpful in pointing out the sights and had offered to book a guided tour of the Vatican Museum/St. Peter's. I gave that a miss at EUR 55/pax. Subsequently there were a number of surly faces manning the check in desk, especially at night. The room and ensuite were clean. We got room 203 which was facing the road but not too much noise. Did not really spend much time in the room anyway as there are too many things to do in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “loved rome”
Reviews.Author: lovetorome
Reviews.Content: we are just back from a 3 night stay in cinquantatre, rome we loved rome, deffinatly the most romantic city in the world the hotel is just ok, the room we had was very small at the back of the hotel with no balcony when we asked for a room with a balcony we were told that the room was even smaller, i don't see how there was only the bed in the room. the Bathroom was the best part and very clean. i think this hotel is a bit more faulty towers, we asked for an Iron and iorning board and they arrived with no board,!!! trying to iron clothes on the floor is not easy. our stay would have been fine if it had not been for check out, we were leaving early around 6.30am and when we tried to pay with Cash they had no change and were not even slightly bothered about how we would get our change, they sent my husband around to a shop that was closed, in the end my husband had to walk 15 mins to find a shop that was open to get change. i feel that if they allow people to pay with cash then they should keep a certain amount of cash there, we were owed 45 euro and there was no way i was leaving that with them, i think that's what they were hoping. the hotel is fine but just fine, you get what you pay for!! however the location was excellent and i would stay in this area again. rome is magical.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: britney2630
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and it is only 100m from the nearest metro station. 10mins walk from the Trevi fountain (which we went to everyday!) and the Spanish steps. All the major sights are in easy walking distance. The room was slightly larger than expected but was rather shabby and in need of updating as bits of paint were peeling off and a plug socket had come lose from the wall. We reported this to one of the reception staff who wasn't particularly interested in this but generally the reception staff were very pleasant. The hotel has strict rules and are not too happy if you do not adhere to these rules - so you have been warned! The breakfast was the usual European fayre and the balcony where breakfast was served was really lovely. I'm not sure whether I would recommend this hotel to friends but I would certainly recommend the area and to be honest there is so much to do in Rome that we spent very little time at the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfoster4
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night in this hotel, but we had a room on the top floor with a nice balcony overlooking the street and a nice little bell tower. The room was small but charming with a big comfortable bed, mini fridge, safe and bathroom with bathtub/shower. The staff was helpful and friendly. It's located about a 15 minute walk from the train station and is easy to find. You can walk to all major sites if you enjoy walking, which we do.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable place and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: taln
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 10 days in Italy....3 nights of which were at the Hotel Cinquantatre (hotel 53). The hotel was small and cute. We had room 401 which overlooked the street and had a cute little terrace off the room. The hotel was very clean, the rooms totally adequate and the bathroom was great. All new marble, towel rack warmers and a clean/great shower. For the price, I'd do it again. Location was great in terms of being close to Piaza Barberini, as well as the hop on/hop off bus, and the metro. Very close to everything! I loved it. You won't be disappointed. And equally important - the staff was great! NIMO was woooonderful. He was so helpful and truly wanted to make sure our stay was a great one. Added bonus - there is an elevator in the hotel. Small, but very much appreciated when it came to our very heavy luggage! Have a blast.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wakka
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in late March 2007. For the price the hotel was excellent. The hotel itself is a bit run down and certainly is not first class, so don't expect anything luxurious. The room and bathroom was quite small, and there were no English speaking television channels (Not that we watched much TV as we were in Rome!!!!). We also had a toilet that wouldn't stop running the entire stay. The breakfast was nothing fancy but it filled me up each morning. The hotel has a great location within walking distance to the Spanish steps, the Pantheon, and the Trevi Fountain. We could also walk to Piazza Navona within 20 minutes. There were also some great restaurants not far from the hotel. The metro is only a 2 minute walk away. The greatest thing about this hotel was its fantastic staff. These guys were the best staff anywhere in Europe. Thankyou especially to Nimo on reception who was so enthusiastic about our time in Rome. He also was extremely caring when my girlfriend became sick and needed a doctor. He arranged everything. The caring and well wishes of other support staff at the hotel were also much appreciated. Nimo even spoke to the cab driver when we left the hotel to make sure we were not ripped off. This was fantastic. You would not get this kind of service at any other hotel in Rome. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty77
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time here. The hotel is hard to find, but well worth it. We had room 502, which had the most lovelist terrace/balcony with a table and 4 chairs. Sure, the hotel isn't the Ritz, but it's clean, beds huge and comfortable. Great bathroom, clean, hot water and perfectly fine. They had heating as well (which is rare in Rome) and it proved vital when staying there in January. The breakfast isn't the greatest, but it's basic, rolls, jams, coffee and OJ - but to be honest we didn't need or want anything else. Warm friendly front of house. Main plus point is it's location - 10 min stroll to Trevi Fountain and there are loads of lovely eateries round there. We walked everywhere and loved it. Also, another plus point is that it's very reasonable. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Cinquantatre”
Reviews.Author: OttoCal
Reviews.Content: Had a great trip to Rome and had no compliants at L'Hotel Cinquantatre. Hard to find listings of reviews, as sometimes you find it alphabatized under L, H, or C, and the website was very tricky to track down, but very nice once I found it. (try using the number 53 instead of spelling it out...) We arrived at about 9:00 a.m. and weren't able to check in that early, but they stored our bags and sent us out with a map to explore. When we checked in, I almost had a heart attack when I saw the room- it was tinier than I had expected, and I have seen small rooms before. But then I realized that we actually had a second small room with a day bed, huge wardrobe, fridge, nice chair, and a nice sized balcony- yay! We were in a room at the back, overlooking a small courtyard. The rooms in the front have a street view (quiet street) and very tiny balconies- just enough room to stand on, no table/chairs. The bathroom had a nice heated towel rack. We got fresh towels 2 times in 6 days, which I think is pretty standard there. The breakfast was included, and it was a pretty good spread- cereal, milk, cornettos, rolls, crackers, spreads, coffee, juice etc. This is from 7-9 every day, and after breakfast the server cleans the rooms. It is a small hotel, mabe 14 rooms or so, with a small and friendly staff. Some of the staff at the desk spoke much better English than others, and were able to help with reservations, directions, calling around to places etc. The others weren't as much help- but it was easy to figure out and just take advantage of the 2 who spoke the best English. I think they were brothers. This hotel is very close to the metro station Barberini. I would suggest at taxi to get to/from Termini, the metro can be tricky wtih luggage, especially if you get stuck during a rush hour. There is a church 1 block away that has fascinating Capuchin Crypts, a great 30 minute stop, especially for teens. There is an Enoteca right across from that church on another side street so you can get a bottle of wine to enjoy on your balcony- there are corkpulls in the rooms and plastic cups in the bath. The fixtures are modern, but there was a small bit of mold in the high up corners in our shower- way too high for the maid to reach. We also noticed some in the room with the internet. The internet is supposed to be 2 Euro for the first 1/2 hour and 1 Euro for each 15 minutes after that, and due to some strange Italian rules they have to copy your passport to let you use it. They didn't end up charging us- probably b/c they didn't want to deal with the additional paperwork on check-out and our stay was pre-paid on Expedia. There is also a large Internet Cafe on the Piazza. They had great suggestions on things to do and see. The Villa Borghese park was a close walk, as well as the Trevi Fountain & Spanish Steps. The American Embassy was also close by, and Hard Rock, which we went to for a couple of drinks when we were feeling cheesy one night. Met some fabulous servicemen from UK and USA there, so it was fun. We liked the restaurants much better in other areas in town, be sure to check your guide books and go to the recommended ones. There are bad restaurants out there trying to hook tourists. There was so much within walking distance, and having the metro right there was great. That line did shut down pretty early in the evening though, probably between 9-10, which was hard to figure out. It is only 2 stops from the Termini Station, so a reasonable walk. The lobby and elevator were quite small, 1 person + luggage, or 2 people, no luggage for the elevator, and probably not more than 3-4 people could fit into the lobby. The hotel is tricky to find, yyou have to look for the glass door with the name & building number. We just looked for the 'BAR' sign, as there was a bar right next door. We thought the hotel was charming, and were really happy with the proximity to the metro stop. We used the metro every day, even for just a stop or 2, since we had the week-long metro cards. Watch out for beggars/children on the metro, if you don't let them catch your eye you should be fine. Mostly we just saw commuters though, not as many tourists, but we were there in the off-season (November). We packed, and used, umbrellas for one day during our trip, but it was sunny and pleasant the rest of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: good location, literally 10 mins walk to the Trevi Fountain. If you don't mind walking and taking in alot of the sights then you can probably walk everywhere! The hotels has a tiny reception and the rooms are quite small, however we were on Floor two and as there are only about 3-4 rooms per floor (total of 5 floors) there really is no noise. The rooms are very clean and so are the bathrooms. Breakfast is contintental but there are alot of coffee houses and small restaurants near the Hotel if you want something extra. The staff are friendly and make sure you grab a map from the reception, we ended up using this more than our pricey travel guide! A cab from the hotel to the Termini main train station is about 8 euros and there is a direct train from Termini to Fumicino airport every 1/2 hour which costs another 8euros. There are no english speaking channels on the TV though but hey your in Italy so get out there and explore! :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 53- Helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Chaseihl
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our stay at L'Hotel 53. Quite honestly, it was not our first choice but the hotel our friends had highly recommended (Daphne B&B) was booked. Actually, the Daphne staff directed us to the Hotel 53. Having been in Rome earlier at a further away and inconvenient location, I did not want to make the same mistake twice. The location was awesome. The hotel is rather simple and actually does not look like much from the outside. The hotel used to be owned by some sort of religious order but was sold or rented 3 years ago to the owners of the hotel. They have basically have been refurbishing the hotel within the last three years. Our room was not too big but it was clean and had a nice decor with antiques. In terms of amenities, our room came equipped with a minifridge, TV and our own bathroom which had recently been renewed . The hotel has a tiny elevator which is rather funny to see . Our above average rating stems from 3 main reasons: 1)friendliness and helpfulness from staff especially Nima and Hugo. H/ever, the other desk people were very helpful as well wether it was helping us find/printing maps for places or even helping us reconfirm our train reservations. Their friendly tone was set from the moment we were calling to make reservations. 2) We loved the convenience of the location (intersection of piazza barberini and via condotti) because the hotel is like a 1-2 minute walk to the Barberini metro station. Walking to the Trevi fountain like in less than 10 minutes, an extra 5-8 minutes to the Panteon. We were even able to walk easily to Piazza Navona and to Campo di Fiori. Having easy access to the main subway line and being at close walking distance from many attractions was a huge time saver!! Plus, the easy access for shopping by Via del Corso was great 3)The hotel doens't have a lobby per say but it has a back room in which you can check internet at any time for free (sooo convenient!) Our rate was 160 euros which seemed reasonable to us. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are many in the nearby streets that we didn't miss it. The breakfast area pretty much looks like in the pictures (from the hotel website and Venere). There are 3 tables in the terrace but the indoor tables are in a nice setting. We loved having breakfast in the terrace which offered a really nice view to day to start your day. The woman in charge of the breakfast is very nice and accomodating. In spite of saying she didn't speak English, she knows enough to get by. Breakfast is the standard fare of breads/croissants, cereals, etc. and you can have as much as you want. Also, I want to point out that we didn't experience any of the "odors" or noise issues that other reviews have cited. Overall, the staff and location made it a very pleasant experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “okay for 100 Euro/ night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cute. There is no lobby to speak of, although there is a sort of nook-area with a computer. (Free high-speed internet). The room itself was nice, Good things - great location rigth next to Barberini metro, hardwood floors, marble bathrooms, near restaurants on via veneto. Several problems. First, there was some sort of ventilation issue in our room (#102) and it smelled like bathroom a lot of the time - pretty gross. Second, our queen bed was actually two twins pushed together - major pet-peve of mine. Third, no CNN (okay that is really nitpicky but still). Fourth, kinda noisy (ask for rooms on higher-up floors. Fifth, no bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved the Cinquantatre”
Reviews.Author: Limoncelllo
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome first weekend in September 2005 with my friend. The Cinquantatre is a typically Italian hotel; it's small but perfectly formed! My friend and I had room 102, it's a lovely room, at the front, with beautiful antique furniture and twin beds. The bathroom is modern with shower etc. The breakfast terrace is fantastic and the breakfast good with as many croisants and rolls as you can eat, as much coffee and juice as you want, also yougurt, cerial etc. If the weather is bad you can breakfast in the very pretty and roomy dinning room. The staff are extremely helpful, and the hotel is very clean; clean sheets and towels every day. Aslo, unusually for Italy the towels are fluffy!!!! The location of the hotel is perfect, just 1 minute up the street from the Piazza Barberini and the metro; very near the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Round the corner is the Palazzo Barberini a beautiful building designed by Bernini which houses a very fine art gallery. Although the hotel is in a central location, it is very quiet with no noise at all at night to keep anybody awake. We both slept very well, as the beds and pillows are extremely comfy. In fact neither of us could find a single fault with the Hotel Cinquantatre, and will certainly use it again the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Cinquantatre Aug 2005. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is 100m’s from the Piazza Barberini, a 2 min walk from the Trevi fountain and 5 mins from the Spanish Steps. The Barberni metro station is close by, which makes getting round the city very easy. The hotel itself is okay – simple & basic. We stayed in room 102 which had no key for the safe and the room key went missing halfway through our stay. Though after our initial panic neither marred our stay at all. The bed was huge and most important of all, the aircon worked perfectly. However, there was a bit of a smell coming from the bathroom, which we think was coming from the shower. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace which affords lovely views of the buildings opposite. Be aware though that there are only three tables on the terrace so you may have to sit in the rather cramped dining room. The breakfast itself is a typical continental affair – croissants and coffee, cereals and a small selection of fruit. The young girl that looks after the breakfast service is very helpful. In fact, all of the staff were very polite, and apart from the safe issue, very helpful Would we stay there again? Yes, though probably not in room 102

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, old world -- great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lmlmlm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night because the Daphne Trevi could not accomodate us. I loved it, my husband liked the Trevi better. 53 is a nice refurbished hotel with antiques, great showers, and good service. The breakfast was very nice, served on the terrace, with a silver tea service. Very nice. Much quieter than the Trevi. I would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: L'Hotel Cinquantatre
HotelInfo.Address: Via Di San Basilio 53, 00187 Rome, Italy
